# Assignment 1

::: {.cell hash='05_dag_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_60ccf44855027122d97fc2f5f8bf2458'}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Load packages
library(tidyverse)
```


```{.r .cell-code}
library(dagitty)
library(ggdag)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'ggdag'
#> 
#> The following object is masked from 'package:stats':
#> 
#>     filter
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
library(ggthemr)
ggthemr("flat")
rm(list = ls())

# Collider
collider <- dagify(
  Sales ~ Parking,
  Sales ~ Location,
  coords = list(x = c(Location = 3, Sales = 2, Parking = 1),
                y = c(Location = 1, Sales = 0, Parking = 1))
)

# Plot DAG
ggdag(collider) +
  geom_dag_point(color = ggthemr::swatch()[2]) +
  geom_dag_text(color = "white") +
  geom_dag_edges(edge_color = "white")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](05_dag_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



# Assignment 2
## 'satisfaction' on 'follow_ups'


::: {.cell hash='05_dag_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_9ede1f3b68684b722b88d26fe3fb1c95'}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Load data
data <- readRDS("~/GitHub/cdsba-lucaspuebla93/Causal_Data_Science_Data/customer_sat.rds")
# print(data)

# Run linear regression: satisfaction on follow_ups
model_1 <- lm(satisfaction ~ follow_ups, data = data)

# Summarize the regression results
summary(model_1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> 
#> Call:
#> lm(formula = satisfaction ~ follow_ups, data = data)
#> 
#> Residuals:
#>     Min      1Q  Median      3Q     Max 
#> -12.412  -5.257   1.733   4.506  12.588 
#> 
#> Coefficients:
#>             Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
#> (Intercept)  78.8860     4.2717  18.467 1.04e-10 ***
#> follow_ups   -3.3093     0.6618  -5.001 0.000243 ***
#> ---
#> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
#> 
#> Residual standard error: 7.923 on 13 degrees of freedom
#> Multiple R-squared:  0.658,	Adjusted R-squared:  0.6316 
#> F-statistic: 25.01 on 1 and 13 DF,  p-value: 0.0002427
```
:::
:::



## 'satisfaction' on 'follow_ups' accounting for 'subscription'


::: {.cell hash='05_dag_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_29c1417eeab1863dee72bda1a1f0860b'}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Run linear regression: satisfaction on follow_ups and account for subscription
model_2 <- lm(satisfaction ~ follow_ups + subscription, data = data)

# Summarize the regression results
summary(model_2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> 
#> Call:
#> lm(formula = satisfaction ~ follow_ups + subscription, data = data)
#> 
#> Residuals:
#>     Min      1Q  Median      3Q     Max 
#> -4.3222 -2.1972  0.3167  2.2667  3.9944 
#> 
#> Coefficients:
#>                      Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
#> (Intercept)           26.7667     6.6804   4.007  0.00206 ** 
#> follow_ups             2.1944     0.7795   2.815  0.01682 *  
#> subscriptionPremium   44.7222     5.6213   7.956 6.88e-06 ***
#> subscriptionPremium+  18.0722     2.1659   8.344 4.37e-06 ***
#> ---
#> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
#> 
#> Residual standard error: 2.958 on 11 degrees of freedom
#> Multiple R-squared:  0.9597,	Adjusted R-squared:  0.9487 
#> F-statistic: 87.21 on 3 and 11 DF,  p-value: 5.956e-08
```
:::
:::



# Assignment 3
The increase in the R-squared coefficient between the model not accounting and the model accounting for 'subscription' suggests that the relationship between 'follow_ups' and 'satisfaction' might vary across different subscription levels. This can be seen in the plots below. 
This difference in the 'follow_ups'-'satisfaction' relationship might be due to clients from different subscription levels having different service expectations or being more demanding regarding follow-up support. Clients subscribing to different levels might also use various features differently, impacting their need for follow-ups as well as their overall satisfaction.


# Assignment 4


::: {.cell hash='05_dag_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_3a05754fc60eaa23c17c91e5519ecab0'}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Not conditioning on subscription
not_cond_plot <- ggplot(data, aes(x = follow_ups, y = satisfaction)) +
  geom_point() +
  stat_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE)

# Conditioning on subscription
cond_plot <- ggplot(data, aes(x = follow_ups, y = satisfaction,
                              color = subscription, 
                              alpha = subscription)) +
  geom_point() +
  stat_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE) +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("Premium" = "blue", "Premium+" = "red", "Elite" = "green")) +
  scale_alpha_manual(values = c("Premium" = 0.5, "Premium+" = 0.6, "Elite" = 0.3)) +
  theme(legend.position = "top")

# Plot both
not_cond_plot
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
#> `geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'
```
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](05_dag_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
cond_plot
```

```

```
